name: I Am Crazy Security Guard Game

ios.subtitle: Got Security Job at Night Club

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: It’s one thing to say you’d never take a bribe: It’s quite another when your options are taking one or missing rent or going hungry. That’s but a taste of the moral quandaries in Papers, Please, which puts you in the shoes of a border checkpoint agent in a fictional 1980s nation. Learning to master passport processing skills, avoiding fines, and making the most of your paycheck is uniquely satisfying and provocative in a way few games manage to achieve. This celebrated indie gem teaches us as much about empathy as it does time management.

Dead Cells is a celebration of perseverence: In this game, death is never final, but an essential learning tool. With every new run through ever-changing, enemy-infested levels, you get a little stronger and a little more skilled at overcoming relentless adversaries—and gradually overcome obstacles that once felt insurmountable. The acclaimed roguelike platformer makes all rewards feel earned; you'll be motivated to to brush off mistakes and charge back into battle again and again.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Reimagining the decades-old blockbuster of the same name, Castle of Illusion Starring Mickey Mouse revamps Disney's love letter to classic platformers with a fantastic new design. Whether you have fond memories of the original or this is your first romp through the manic lands of the evil witch Mizrabel, Castle of Illusion epitomizes fantastic platforming. It’s an outstanding return for Disney’s most beloved mascot.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: This is not relaxing. This is not simple. But it is so, so good.
editorialNotes.tagline: Beware: this game has no mercy

editorialNotes.standard: Follow the story of the acclaimed anime—or hop straight into battle as your favorite heroes—in the action-packed mobile version of the 2008 fighting game.
Control a massive arcade claw machine to grab knives, swords, and other handy items as you delve deep into this clever roguelike RPG.

editorialNotes.standard: Talk about wild family outings! Help the Bergson bunch battle evil in this gorgeous throwback RPG.

editorialNotes.standard: Striking artwork, dark humor, and great dialogue liven up this point-and-click adventure about uncovering the cause of a deadly outbreak.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: This turn-based RPG recalls the secret-filled dungeons of old-school classics—and adds contemporary tweaks like awesome lighting effects and a streamlined interface.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: One of the most influential RPGs of all time, Final Fantasy VII takes you on an unforgettable journey through a harsh and unforgiving sci-fi landscape. Packed with tense turn-based combat and an extraordinary story, Square Enix’s masterpiece is as exhilarating now as it was when it was first released in 1997.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: Can you get away with murder?

editorialNotes.standard: You’ve got eight wickedly tense hours to get away with murder in this sublime whodunit. It’s a brainteasing delight bribing, framing, and wooing your fellow cruise-ship passengers. Should you chat up nosy Lady Honoria Armstrong or play cards with Carstairs in the smoking room? Every failed getaway encourages another try—one where you explore different areas at different times and engage in new conversations. Brilliantly written and immaculately detailed, Overboard! makes dabbling in deception great fun—and that’s the truth.

editorialNotes.short: Check out a heartfelt retro-style tale that transcends time and space.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Explore imposing dungeons, battle savage monsters, and travel the high seas in this luscious top-down fantasy adventure from Cornfox & Bros. Featuring gorgeous art direction reminiscent of The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker, music by legendary videogame composers Nobuo Uematsu and Kenji Ito, and a wonderful world filled with secrets, Oceanhorn is an incredible journey.
editorialNotes.short: Explore uncharted seas in this beautiful, action-packed gem.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Tend to crops—and find love—while revitalizing your hometown in this cozy made-for-mobile spin on the beloved farming simulator.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: This impressive mash-up does so many things right, it’s hard to know where to start. How about the story, a tense sci-fi drama told in rapid-fire dialogue? Love that! And then the action starts, flooring us by how smoothly the puzzle-style path-finding snaps together with the turn-based battles. The longer the path you draw, the harder you hit? Love that even more!

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: From indie developer Evan Kice, Afterplace is an unforgettable RPG lovingly crafted for mobile, forgoing virtual buttons in favor of swipes and taps to control its precise combat. The game is also just a delight to explore, brimming with surprises ranging from sarcastic vending machines to nightmarish bosses. Even after two playthroughs, we’re still finding new paths, new choices, and unexpected encounters that make us laugh.

For builders and tinkerers, the planet Woanope couldn’t be a better place to be stranded. It’s overflowing with flowers, crystals, animals, and a zillion other resources you can quickly craft into everything from comfy furniture to vicious weapons. A never-ending string of new locations and inventions keeps this survival RPG engrossing, and its oddball humor pulls you in even more. We looked forward to every wacky conversation with our robo-companion and random alien creatures—and to the awesome discoveries we’d make when they sent us on quests.
editorialNotes.short: Fight monsters. Chop down trees. Build new things. It's a survivalist's delight.

editorialNotes.standard: From the makers of indie masterpiece Bastion, this stunning RPG thrusts you into a hauntingly beautiful sci-fi world brimming with intrigue. To unravel the mysteries of Cloudbank, you’ll need to fight robotic goons in intense tactical battles while modifying your weapon with powerful new abilities. Transistor’s gorgeous artwork, affecting soundtrack, and riveting story all blend to create a truly one-of-a-kind experience.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: We love BioWare for Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic and their other epic role-playing games, but this particular gem from their back catalog shines like a glorious green dragon. Infused with Chinese myth and populated by unforgettable characters, Jade Empire: Special Edition is a beautiful update of the classic action-RPG. The intuitive touch controls make it that much easier for us to get lost in its massive, martial-arts world of intrigue, adventure—and even a bit of romance.
editorialNotes.short: Try this remastered classic from the makers of Mass Effect.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Originally released in 2000, Final Fantasy IX set a new standard for the series—and it’s still astoundingly impressive. It’s a perfect blend of beloved RPG elements from previous entries and modernized battle encounters. As you make your way through the story’s twists and turns, you’ll encounter unforgettable characters, frighteningly powerful enemies, and a wonderful fantasy world to explore.

Not only is Knights of the Old Republic one of the best Star Wars games, but it's also regarded as one of the best role-playing games ever made. This version of BioWare's remarkable achievement features an interface adjusted for touch input. It lets you wield the Force and slash lightsabers across multiple worlds as you team up with brilliantly realized characters and follow an intriguing plot shaped by the choices you make.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: Flying Dragon's Life Simulator
artistName: EXTREMESOFT BILISIM REKLAMCILIK TICARET LIMITED SIRKETI

ios.subtitle: Fly free, train a baby dragon

editorialNotes.short: The ultimate outcome is up to you in this incredible tale of survival.
editorialNotes.standard: The first in a series of groundbreaking text adventures, Lifeline kept us in suspense the whole time, desperately awaiting the next message from marooned astronaut Taylor. As you receive text notifications telling you what Taylor’s doing, you reply with instructions on which way to travel, whether to explore a derelict ship, and other crucial decisions. The tension mounts as you try to help the castaway survive, and the option to rewind and pick different choices makes the game wonderfully replayable.

ios.subtitle: Live the life of a real dog!
